item.title: Node40 Affiliate Program Takes Off, Get Dash to Help Grow Network
item.description:
Node40 Affiliate Program Takes Off, Get Dash to Help Grow Network

May 16, 2016 Disclaimer: This is a press release. Bitcoinist is not responsible for this firm's products and/or services. Albany, NY - Node40 eases the barrier to user-owned and operated nodes, offering an intuitive framework for the promotion and growth of robust decentralized networks.

item.title: Presidential Cybersecurity Panel Hears Blockchain Testimony By IBM - CoinDesk
item.description:
Presidential Cybersecurity Panel Hears Blockchain Testimony By IBM - CoinDesk

A panel on national security and cyberspace appointed by President Barack Obama heard testimony on blockchain technology from representatives of IBM earlier today. Held in New York, the meeting brought together the Commission on Enhancing National Cybersecurity, formed in February by executive order and featuring among its membership retired General Keith Alexander, the first chief of the US Cyber Command.

item.title: Bitcoin tech to improve clinical trial research transparency
item.description:
Bitcoin tech to improve clinical trial research transparency

In an effort to improve transparency in clinical trial research, two doctors created a system that coverts trial documents into a Bitcoin - an online equivalent of cash. The new approach, which prevents clinical trial documents from being altered to make new medications look more effective, was developed by Greg Irving, of the University of Cambridge, and John Holden - both practicing doctors concerned about the trustworthiness of clinical trials.

item.title: Everyone's Favorite Crypto Just Might Scale After All - Bitcoinist.net
item.description:
Everyone's Favorite Crypto Just Might Scale After All - Bitcoinist.net

The popular Bitcoin explorer and wallet company Also read: Japanese Company Raising Funds Abuses Tech Bureau Corp. Credentials Blockchain.info has revealed a new protocol to the cryptocurrency ecosystem called the Thunder Network . The project is in its alpha release and the code is open source.

item.title: Coin Citadel is Raising Bitcoin to Increase its Holdings - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Coin Citadel is Raising Bitcoin to Increase its Holdings - NEWSBTC

Coin Citadel is raising about $750000 worth of bitcoins in the coming days, says the company's press release. Read more... Coin Citadel, the company that has been involved in bitcoin-based business for a while now has decided to increase its bitcoin holding by over $750,000 in the coming days.

item.title: Ethereum-powered DAO surpasses $100-million mark in crowdsale
item.description:
Ethereum-powered DAO surpasses $100-million mark in crowdsale

An organization called The DAO, running on the Ethereum platform, has raised more than $118 million USD in ether, as of Monday afternoon, in a crowdfunding campaign that is just over two weeks old....

item.title: Bitland Puts Land Titles on the Blockchain in Ghana
item.description:
Bitland Puts Land Titles on the Blockchain in Ghana

African blockchain project Bitland aims to use Bitcoin's underlying technology for land title protection, with the goal of preventing corruption and opening "trillions" of dollars for infrastructure development. Disclaimer: This article was provided by Bitcoin PR Buzz. Bitcoinist is not affiliated with the firms represented by Bitcoin PR Buzz and is not responsible for their products and/or services.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Tests $460 But Fails at Upward Climb - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Tests $460 But Fails at Upward Climb - CoinDesk

The price of bitcoin tested resistance at $460 over the weekend ending 15th May, but failed to break through what could prove to be a key level going forward. Overall, the digital currency's price fluctuated close to $460, a figure which has not been surpassed since 10th May, reaching as much as $458.87 on Sunday, 15th May, according to the CoinDesk USD Bitcoin Price Index (BPI).

item.title: I am interested in storing information on the blockchain, where do I start?
item.description:
I am interested in storing information on the blockchain, where do I start?

Or do you need to have the information immutable and publically verifiable? Need to transfer a token of actual value in real time to a third party? Use a public chain. you'll need to figure out the requirements for your particular need and then find the best solution.
